content:
1. Carbon Fiber Harps - These harps are made out of modern composite materials that improve the harp's strength, durability and sound quality. They are made to withstand the demands of modern music and are suitable for professionals.

2. Lever Harps - These harps have levers under each string, which make it easy to play in different keys without having to retune the harp. They have revolutionized the way modern harp players approach music by allowing for quick and easy key changes.

3. Electronic Harps - These harps are essentially an electric guitar version of the traditional harp. It uses electronic circuits to produce a sound and allows the player to create a wide range of tones and sound effects not possible on an acoustic harp.

4. Extended Range Harps - These harps have added strings to increase their range and have become a popular option for modern music. The added strings increase the harp's range without sacrificing playability and sound quality.

5. Semi-Acoustic Harps - This modern harp uses both electric and acoustic components to enhance the player's sound. It produces a warm, resonant sound that can be amplified electronically for a more modern edge.
